chat.msg: Hello! Welcome to our map navigation game. Are you ready to start the adventure?
Fantastic! Alright, let's begin. You are currently at the top-right corner of the map. Take a step to your left.
Great! Now, just a little further to the left, you'll find a small island. Take a path just below the leopard resting there. Can you see the island and the leopard?

Perfect! Now, cross over a wooden twig that leads to a larger island. On this island, you'll find a parrot and an elephant. Go over the head of the parrot and continue south, between the parrot and the elephant. Can you see the parrot and the elephant?
Awesome! You're doing great so far. Now, leave this island in a south-easterly direction, crossing over 3 rocks - 2 gray ones and a darker one. Can you see the rocks?

Fantastic! Keep up the good work. Now, you should reach a new island with a frog on it. Continue your journey by going below (south of) the frog and then do a u-turn to the left (west). Can you see the frog?

Great job! Now, continue on the path by crossing over the back of a crocodile. This will take you back to the island with the parrot and the elephant, but this time you'll be going left (west). Can you see the crocodile?

Well done! Now, continue your journey by crossing over two gray rocks towards an island with a giraffe. The giraffe is located at the left side of the map. Go below the giraffe (southwest), then turn 90 degrees to the left (southeast). Can you see the giraffe?
Amazing! You're almost there. Now, follow the path as it takes you to another island with a snake on it. Go over the snake and you're almost at your final destination. Can you see the snake?

Fantastic! Now, just a little further and you'll reach your final destination, the treasure! Keep going in the direction you're heading, and you'll find the treasure waiting for you. Good luck, and enjoy your well-deserved reward!

chat.msg: Hello! Welcome to our navigation game. Are you ready to explore the map and follow the path?
Great! Let's start our adventure. You are currently at the top-right corner of the map, next to a white dog. First, take a step to your left (west). Can you see a wooden bench just in front of you?

Excellent! Now, carefully go below the wooden bench and keep moving in the same direction. You will come across a stream. Cross the stream and continue heading towards the florist stand. But don't go all the way to the stand, instead, make a U-turn to your left and cross the stream again.

Great job! Now, after crossing the stream for the second time, continue to your left (west). You will soon come across a wooden branch crossing a river. Cross over the branch towards the south. Keep going southwards until you reach another white dog sitting next to a red and white checkered picnic mat. Can you see the mat?

Fantastic! Now, step on the mat and continue moving west. Look out for another wooden branch that crosses the river again, this time heading north. Once you cross the river, make sure to go around a green bush from the right side. Keep circling the bush until you reach the florist stand.

Well done! Now, as you reach the florist stand, turn left (west) and go below the stand. You will soon come across a big bridge with two people riding a bicycle. Pass by the bridge on its west side. Keep going forward until you see two elderly people sitting on a bench, each reading a newspaper. 

Once you're in front of the old people, take a few steps to the south, passing between them and another wooden branch. Now, you should see a green bush next to the end of the wooden branch. Walk towards the bush. 

From there, head east, passing between the branch and the bush. And just a few steps to the east, you will spot a brown young deer. Congratulations, you have reached your final destination!

chat.msg: Hello! Welcome to the game. Are you ready to navigate the map and follow the path I'll guide you through?
Great! Let's get started. You are currently at the opening of a tent at the top part of the map. First, take a few steps south of the tent. Can you see the trail in front of you?
Excellent! Now, continue along the trail to the east until you reach a puppy. Can you spot the adorable little doggy?
Lovely! From the puppy, turn left (east) and continue a few steps until you see a small bonfire to the north of the trail. Can you see it?
Perfect! Now, leave the trail and pass the bonfire on the left (north). Keep heading east until you come across two red mushrooms. Can you spot them?
Great job! Now, here's a little twist. Instead of going straight to the mushrooms, make a right u-turn and head back west on the trail. Let me know when you're there!
Awesome! Now, at the fork in the trail, take the left (south) branch. As you continue, you'll pass by a telescope on your right. Keep going until you're past it. Let me know when you're there!
Fantastic! Now, veer right and take an off-trail shortcut around the telescope. Circle around it until you reach the trail again. Let me know once you're back on the trail!
Perfect! You're doing great. Now, continue west on the trail until you spot a low wall of rocks surrounding a wooden cabin. This will be our final destination. Can you see the cabin?

Wonderful! You've successfully followed the path and reached the wooden cabin. Well done! You've completed the game. I hope you enjoyed navigating the map and following my instructions. If you have any other questions or if you'd like to play again, just let me know!

general_survey.question: Have you ever lived in a home environment or country where your second language was spoken? If so, please explain briefly:
On a day-to-day basis, how likely are you to have a conversation using both your first and second languages?
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At work
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At home
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with friends
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with family
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Using social media
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?
